drupalNodeEvent.title: Young, Marxist, and Martyred: The First Movers of Chinese Communism

field_description.processed:
LIVING THE SOCIALIST MODERN: The Chinese Communist Party at 100—Global and Interdisciplinary Perspectives [Session 1]

Abstract: China’s early communism surfaced as a topic of historical inquiry only in the years after Mao. Over time the resurrection of the obliviated memories of those who lived and died in the 1920s went beyond mere gestures of historical rectification. This lecture asks: What is that history of communism that pre-dates the ascendancy of Mao as its top theorist? And how might a rereading of the past point to the future as the Party marks its centennial?
